alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 2:35PM EDT until June 16 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Cattaraugus County in western New York... Southwestern Erie County in western New York... Chautauqua County in western New York... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 234 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Findley Lake to Cranesville, Pennsylvania, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Jamestown, Dunkirk, Fredonia, Westfield, Lakewood, Gowanda, Silver Creek, Falconer, Ashford and Mayville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 61 and 58. Interstate 86 between exits 4 and 16. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
